intro.p: In preparation for the 2026 midterm elections, a watchdog organization is tracking how often social media posts viewed by users contain misleading political information. A major platform claims only {{p0dec}}\% of political posts shared by users contain false or misleading content.
The watchdog group takes a random sample of {{s}} political post and finds {{x}} flagged by independent fact-checkers as misleading or false.

Compute the confidence interval for the sample at a {{CL}}\% confidence level and provide all your computations. You may use an app to do the computations. Provide a screenshot of any app you use and all computation you do. Use your confidence interval to answer the follow:

content.p: What is \hat{p}? Please give your answer exact to four decimal places.
What is the standard error for this interval? Please give your answer exact to four decimal places.
What is the confidence interval? Please give your answer in proper interval format exact to four decimal places.
Put your interval into the context of the scenario.

outtro.p: We can say with {{CL}}\% confidence, that between {{LB_p}}\% and {{UB_p}}% of political post shared by users contain false or misleading contect.

intro.p: The watchdog group argues that the percentage of political posts shared with false or misleading content is NOT {{p0dec}}\%. Do a hypothesis test using the same sample and confidence level from Part A. You may use an app to do the test. If you do so, you must insert a screenshot of your work and also specifically identify the following:

content.p: What are your null and alternative hypotheses? Be sure to use appropriate notation and justify your choice of the alternative hypothesis from the context of the problem.
What is the p-value of your test?
What is the conclusion of your hypothesis test? Include statistical justification for your conclusion.
Does the hypothesis test support the claim of the watchdog group? Why or why not?
Compare the results from the confidence interval and the hypothesis test
Are your results from your confidence interval and your hypothesis test consistent? In other words, do both types of inference tests support the same conclusion? Explain why or why not.
